title: CSC101_StudentProfile
description: Comprehensive student profile for AI-powered personalization in CSC 101: Intro to Computing & AI

studentId.description: Unique anonymized identifier for the student

preSurveyResponses.description: Raw responses from the pre-survey organized by section

q2_declaredMajor.description: Q2: Declared or intended major (from dropdown)

q3_consideringMajors.description: Q3: Major categories being considered (if undecided)

q4_firstGeneration.description: Q4: First person in family to attend 4-year college

q5_wheregrewUp.description: Q5: City/Town, State/Country where grew up

q7_englishProficiency.description: Q7: Comfort reading academic content in English

q8_primaryLanguage.description: Q8: Primary language spoken at home

q9_otherLanguages.description: Q9: Other languages spoken or understood

q10_multilingualSupport.description: Q10: Wants key terms in another language

q12_hobbiesDescription.description: Q12: Free text description of hobbies and passions

q15_modalityRanking.description: Q15: Ranking of learning modalities (1=most preferred)

q17_instructionPreference.description: Q17: Preference for learning new skills

q19_courseMotivation.description: Q19: Primary reason for taking course

q20_careerRelevance.description: Q20: Perceived relevance to future career (1-5 Likert)

q21_learningGoals.description: Q21: Free text learning goals for the course

section6_priorLearning.description: Section 6: Prior Learning & Experience by Topic (Q22-Q44)

q23_understandingLevel.description: Q23: Self-rated understanding of how AI systems work

q24_aiToolUsageFrequency.description: Q24: Frequency of AI tool usage

q25_aiToolUseCases.description: Q25: What AI tools have been used for

q30_projectComplexity.description: Q30: Most complex programming project completed

q32_networkingConcepts.description: Q32: Networking concepts that can be explained

q35_howLearned.description: Q35: How learned about data analysis

q36_dataConcepts.description: Q36: Data concepts that can be explained

q39_howLearned.description: Q39: How learned about digital content creation

q41_websiteComfort.description: Q41: Comfort level with creating websites

q42_howLearned.description: Q42: How learned about tech ethics

q44_criticalThinking.description: Q44: Frequency of critical thinking about tech's societal impact

q45_computingConfidence.description: Q45: Confidence in learning computing/programming (1-5 Likert)

q46_growthMindset.description: Q46: Agreement with 'I can learn computing skills if I put in effort' (1-5 Likert)

q48_difficultyResponse.description: Q48: Typical response to difficult problems

q49_weeklyHours.description: Q49: Expected weekly hours for course

q53_culturalContext.description: Q53: Cultural traditions/communities important for relevance (optional free text)

preTestResponses.description: Raw responses and scores from the pre-test

timeSpentSeconds.description: Total time spent on pre-test in seconds

derivedProfile.description: Processed profile data derived from survey/test responses for AI consumption

priorKnowledgeByTopic.description: Computed experience levels by topic area (1-5 scale)

needsEncouragement.description: Computed: low confidence or math anxiety

aiGenerationParameters.description: Computed parameters for AI content generation, updated dynamically

stepCount.description: Recommended number of steps in explanations

encouragementLevel.description: Based on confidence and anxiety levels

supplementaryLanguage.description: Language for occasional term explanations, if requested

preferredModalities.description: Ordered list of preferred content formats

skipAndExtend.description: Content that can be skipped or extended based on prior knowledge

avoidanceFlags.description: Topics or contexts to avoid based on negative feedback

ongoingData.description: Data collected during course progress (populated over time)
